allow: Bash(PYTHONPATH=. python -c "import sys; sys.path.insert\(0, ''.''\); from src.models.task import TaskCreate; print\(''Task model imported successfully''\)")
Bash(python -c "import fastapi, sqlmodel, uvicorn; print\(''Required packages are available''\)")
Bash(python -c "from src.main import app; import uvicorn; uvicorn.run\(app, host=''0.0.0.0'', port=8000\)" --reload)
Bash(python -c "from src.main import app; import uvicorn; uvicorn.run\(app, host=''0.0.0.0'', port=8000\)")

Bash(python -c "
from src.main import app
print\(''Backend app loaded successfully''\)

# Test basic functionality
from src.database.database import create_db_and_tables
create_db_and_tables\(\)
print\(''Database tables created successfully''\)

# Test that the routes exist
routes = [route.path for route in app.routes]
print\(f''Found {len\(routes\)} routes''\)
auth_routes = [route for route in app.routes if ''auth'' in route.path.lower\(\)]
print\(f''Found {len\(auth_routes\)} auth-related routes''\)
print\(''Routes:'', [route.path for route in app.routes][:10], ''...''\)
")

Bash(python -c "
# Test the auth service directly
from src.services.auth_service import AuthService
from src.database.database import get_session
from src.models.user import UserCreate
from sqlmodel import Session

# Test that we can import and create an auth service
print\(''AuthService can be imported successfully''\)

# Test creating a session and auth service
with next\(get_session\(\)\) as session:
    auth_service = AuthService\(session\)
    print\(''AuthService instantiated successfully with session''\)
    
# Test that we can access the auth routes
from src.api.v1.auth import router
print\(f''Auth router has {len\(router.routes\)} routes''\)
for route in router.routes:
    if hasattr\(route, ''methods''\) and hasattr\(route, ''path''\):
        print\(f''  {list\(route.methods\)} {route.path}''\)
")
